ElementSecuritypolicyviolation_event.summary: The securitypolicyviolation event is fired when a Content Security Policy is violated.

remarks.para:
The event is fired on the element that violates the policy and bubbles.
It is normally handled by an event handler on the or object.
The handler can be assigned using the onsecuritypolicyviolation property or using .

blockquote.para:
Note: You must add the handler for this event to a top level object (i.e. or ).
While the property exists in HTML elements, you can't assign a handler to the property until the elements have been loaded, by which time this event will already have fired.
